version.xmlsource: This XML content was developed by AHRQ's contractor ECRI Institute for the National Quality Measures Clearinghouse (NQMC).

section.name: General
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Renal cancer: proportion of patients diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma (RCC) who were clinically staged using tumour node metastases (TNM) staging system before first treatment."/>

<fieldvalue value="
NHS Scotland, Scottish Cancer Taskforce, National Cancer Quality Steering Group. Renal cancer clinical quality performance indicators. Edinburgh (Scotland): Healthcare Improvement Scotland; 2016 Oct. 33 p. [20 references]"/>

fieldvalue.value: Does not apply to this measure

section.name: Brief Abstract
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
This measure is used to assess the proportion of patients diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma (RCC) who were clinically staged using tumour node metastases (TNM) staging system before first treatment.
Note from the National Quality Measures Clearinghouse: This measure is part of the Cancer Quality Performance Indicators (QPIs) collection. For more information, including a complete list of QPI measure sets, please visit the Healthcare Improvement Scotland Web site."/>

<fieldvalue value="
The tumour node metastases (TNM) stage of disease will aid in determining prognosis, choice of therapy and follow up (National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence [NICE], 2002).
The TNM staging system is widely recommended for staging of renal cell carcinoma as it has consequences for prognosis and therapy (Ljungberg et al., 2014; NICE, 2002). "/>

<fieldvalue value="
Ljungberg B, Bensalah K, Bex A, Canfield S, Dabestani S, Hofmann F, Hora M, Kuczyk MA, Lam T, Marconi L, Merseburger AS, Mulders PFA, Powles T, Staehler M, Volpe A. Guidelines on renal cell carcinoma. Arnhem (The Netherlands): European Association of Urology (EAU); 2014. 70 p. "/> <fieldvalue value="
National Institute for Clinical Excellence (NICE). Improving outcomes in urological cancers. London (UK): National Institute for Clinical Excellence (NICE); 2002 Sep. 141 p. [3 references]"/> <fieldvalue value="
NHS Scotland, Scottish Cancer Taskforce, National Cancer Quality Steering Group. Renal cancer clinical quality performance indicators. Edinburgh (Scotland): Healthcare Improvement Scotland; 2016 Oct. 33 p. [20 references]"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Renal cell carcinoma (RCC); tumour node metastases (TNM) staging system"/>

<fieldvalue value="
All patients diagnosed with cell carcinoma (RCC) "/>

<fieldvalue value="
Number of patients diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma (RCC) who were clinically staged using tumour node metastases (TNM) staging system before first treatment (see the related "Numerator Inclusions/Exclusions" field) "/>

section.name: Evidence Supporting the Measure

field.name: Type of Evidence Supporting the Criterion of Quality for the Measure

fieldvalue.value: A clinical practice guideline or other peer-reviewed synthesis of the clinical research evidence
A formal consensus procedure, involving experts in relevant clinical, methodological, public health and organizational sciences

field.name: Additional Information Supporting Need for the Measure

section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Unspecified"/>

<fieldvalue value="
The collection of data is piloted on a small number of patient records using a paper data collection form produced by the Information Services Division (ISD). The aim is to identify any anomalies or difficulties with data collection prior to full implementation. At least one NHS board in each Regional Cancer Network participates in the pilot."/>

field.name: Evidence for Extent of Measure Testing

section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
NHS Scotland. National cancer quality performance indicators: overview of development process. Edinburgh (Scotland): NHS Scotland; 2012 Dec. 7 p. "/>

section.name: State of Use of the Measure
Application of the Measure in its Current Use

Least Aggregated Level of Services Delivery Addressed

section.name: Institute of Medicine (IOM) National Health Care Quality Report Categories
Data Collection for the Measure
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Unspecified"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Inclusions
All patients diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma (RCC)
Exclusions
None"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Inclusions
Number of patients diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma (RCC) who were clinically staged using tumour node metastases (TNM) staging system before first treatment
Note: For a patient to be recorded as having been clinically staged using the TNM staging system, cT, cN and cM all require to be recorded.
Exclusions
None "/>

fieldvalue.value: Fixed time period or point in time
Does not apply to this measure

field.name: Instruments Used and/or Associated with the Measure

section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Unspecified"/>

section.name: Computation of the Measure

fieldvalue.value: Does not apply to this measure
Desired value is a higher score

field.name: Allowance for Patient or Population Factors

section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Target: 98%
The tolerance within the target accounts for the small number of renal cancers found incidentally on the pathological specimen of kidneys removed for benign reasons. "/>

<fieldvalue value="
NHS Scotland, Scottish Cancer Taskforce, National Cancer Quality Steering Group. Renal cancer clinical quality performance indicators. Edinburgh (Scotland): Healthcare Improvement Scotland; 2016 Oct. 33 p. [20 references]"/>

section.name: Disclaimer
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
The National Quality Measures Clearinghouseâ„¢ (NQMC) does not develop, produce, approve, or endorse the measures represented on this site.
All measures summarized by NQMC and hosted on our site are produced under the auspices of medical specialty societies, relevant professional associations, public and private organizations, other government agencies, health care organizations or plans, individuals, and similar entities.
Measures represented on the NQMC Web site are submitted by measure developers, and are screened solely to determine that they meet the NQMC Inclusion Criteria.
NQMC, AHRQ, and its contractor ECRI Institute make no warranties concerning the content or its reliability and/or validity of the quality measures and related materials represented on this site. Moreover, the views and opinions of developers or authors of measures represented on this site do not necessarily state or reflect those of NQMC, AHRQ, or its contractor, ECRI Institute, and inclusion or hosting of measures in NQMC may not be used for advertising or commercial endorsement purposes.
Readers with questions regarding measure content are directed to contact the measure developer."/>
